Situation1: The partner is grieving the sudden loss of a close family member.
Expectation2: Ensure compliance with safety and regulatory standards
Situation2: A recently updated standard will apply to the upcoming release, and evidence of conformity is required
Story: I sat on the edge of the bed, laptop open, my inbox flooded with urgent messages from the compliance team. The new safety standard was rolling out tomorrow, and I was responsible for making sure our project met every requirement. My mind raced through checklists and documentation, but my heart was somewhere else. In the next room, my boyfriend was curled up on the couch, silent and hollow after the news of his brother’s passing. He needed me—needed my comfort, my presence, my words. I could hear his quiet sobs, and guilt twisted in my chest. I wanted to hold him, to be the anchor he could lean on, but the clock was ticking on my deadline. My manager’s expectations echoed in my mind: no mistakes, no delays, everything by the book. I felt split in two, torn between the person I loved and the responsibility I couldn’t ignore. My hands hovered over the keyboard, but my heart pulled me toward the living room. I didn’t know which way to turn.
